data.name: Toronto Machine Learning Summit
data.description:
Machine learning, deep learning, and AI are some of the fastest growing and most exciting areas to work: Businesses are using AI to create unprecedented business advantages that are shaping the Canadian landscape. Practitioners are expanding their skills to become high impact global leaders.

Despite the vast opportunities, there are also explicit challenges.

To address this, and to foster the growth of ML/AI in Toronto we have gathered the top insight, feedback and expertise from our community of over 6,000 local members to create 2 parallel streams over 2 days: One for Businesses, and one for Practitioners.

Joining under one roof will be:

-ML PhD/deep learning researchers
-C-level business leaders
-Industry experts
-Various university machine learning groups

The content will be practical, non-sponsored and tailored to our local eco-system. 

C-level executives (including non-tech leaders) will explore practical, immediate opportunities, and clear next steps.  

Practitioners will dissect technical approaches, tools, languages and techniques to explore NLP, neural nets, Reinforcement learning, Generative adversarial networks (GANs), Evolution strategies, AutoML and much more!  

Each ticket will give access to all:

-Workshops
-Real case studies
-Honorable keynotes
-both high-level and granular discussions
-Ample Networking opportunities 


Community follow-ups through a social channel, and tailored post-event gatherings.

Register now to reserve your spot!  

You can send a message to info@torontomachinelearning.com with any questions, requests to speak, or sponsorship opportunities. 

Hope to see you there!

TMLS.

data.name: Intro to Machine Learning with Google's Product Manager
data.description:
** No more Early Bird tickets available **

** RSVP on Eventbrite to get your ticket: http://bit.ly/2qxuz2E **

This workshop will introduce students to how product managers harness data and machine learning to build products. During the event, Melody will discuss her experience as a Product Manager at Google Home and how she uses machine learning to inform her decisions.  

Meet the Speaker: Melody Ivory
Melody is a Product Manager at Google specialized in machine learning. Before Google she worked at Microsoft as the Senior User Experience Researcher and at GE Power as the Senior Product Manager. 

** RSVP on Eventbrite here: http://bit.ly/2qxuz2E **

data.name: March For Science - San Francisco
data.description:
April 22, 2017
We Walk Into The Streets

Start: Justin Herman Plaza, 11:00AM
End: Civic Center Plaza
A rally with invited speakers will start the event at 11:00AM in Justin Herman Plaza. After the rally at approximately 12:30PM, we will march down Market street to Civic Center Plaza, ending with a Fair to celebrate science. Events at Civic Center Plaza will conclude at 6pm.

**All segments of the event will be assisted by a team of volunteers as well as the San Francisco Emergency Services to ensure safety of all attendees. Water and sanitation stations will be provided as well as accessible seating and transportation as needed. If you would like to attend the March For Science - San Francisco and will need assistance, please contact us in advance at logistics@marchforsciencesf.com. Sign making is encouraged, though we ask you to keep this event "family friendly".**

The March for Science - San Francisco celebrates public discovery, understanding, and distribution of scientific knowledge as crucial to the freedom, success, health, and safety of life on this planet. We are a nonpartisan group, marching in support of the following goals: Communication, Funding, Policy, Literacy, and Diversity.  For more information about the March For Science - San Francisco, go to www.marchforsciencesf.com .


Official FB group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/sciencemarchsf/
https://twitter.com/ScienceMarchSF/
Instagram: ScienceMarchSF
Snapchat: ScienceMarchSF
Youtube: ScienceMarchSF

Official Hashtags: #ScienceMarchSF #ScienceInTheBay

MARCH FOR SCIENCE - SAN FRANCISCO WILL JOIN 8TH ANNUAL EARTH DAY SAN FRANCISCO FESTIVAL(EDSF) AT CIVIC CENTER PLAZA!

For the last eight years, EDSF has hosted  Earth Day events in parks around San Francisco attended by up to 10,000 people from the Bay Area and beyond. On Saturday, April 22, 2017, the festival will showcase  educational exhibits, a music stage, expert speakers and seminars, an electric car pavilion, The Sustainable  Chef showcase, organic and vegan food courts, wine and beer gardens, clean energy zone, cutting edge earth friendly products, an electric vehicle showcase, kids zone and more.  For more information go to www.earthdaysf.org .  Visit the festival’s Facebook pages at https://www.facebook.com/EarthDaySF/  and https://www.facebook.com/events/1979689940099

data.name: Healing Hearts II: Resilience in the Face of Racial Trauma
data.description: How do we process? How do we remian resilient? Join CAPS staff and a panel of Purdue Faculty and Staff to discuss how to remain resilient in the face of racial trauma faced in our lives and on campus. Panelists will share how their racial and/or ethnic identities have impacted their careers, how they have navigated academia and predominantly white institutions as members of underrepresented communities.  To be sure, the discussion may include other aspects of identities such as class, sexualit and gender.

data.name: Immigration Presentations (OPT, H1B, PR) by David Ware
data.description:
Purdue University’s Office of Legal Counsel, Office of International Students and Scholars, and Center for Career Opportunities will be hosting prominent U.S. immigration attorney David Ware for two information sessions for international students and scholars on November 8, 2016. 

November 8th, 3:00 – 4:30 PM, Fowler Hall: This presentation will focus on Paths to Permanent Residence for Research Scholars and Professors, including common concepts, general steps (Extraordinary Ability, Outstanding Professor/Researcher, Advanced Degree Professionals & Aliens of Exceptional Ability, Labor Certification, National Interest Waiver, etc.), and the dispelling of myths surrounding the path to U.S. permanent residence.

November 8th, 4:30 – 6:00 PM, Fowler Hall: This presentation will focus on Post Graduation Employment Options for Students, including where to start, OPT, H-1B, bridging the gap between OPT and H-1B, other visa options, paths to permanent residence.

Mr. Ware has over 34 years of experience representing universities and their students, faculty, and staff, as well as companies and individuals. His firm focuses on immigration issues relevant to the faculty, staff and scholars of academic institutions, while also handling business, family, removal, asylum, and nationality cases. He has for many years been selected to the Bar Register of Preeminent Lawyers, and has been selected as one of the Best Lawyers in America since 2000. He regularly serves as an expert speaker and author at national and regional immigration conferences, and at the meetings of academically-oriented organizations.

data.name: Stand with Standing Rock Teach-In & Brown Bag
data.description:
Come learn more about the struggle of water protectors in Standing Rock, ND, and the #NoDAPL movement, including what actions you can take to support indigenous communities who are fighting to potect their water and sacred sites from the Dakota Access Pipeline (DAPL) and Energy Transfer Partners.

This brown bag will feature a talk by Dr. Dawn Marsh, Professor of History and Director of Native American & Indigenous Studies at Purdue. Other panel participants will be Raymond Redcorn, a graduate student in Agricultural and Biological Engineering and Janelle Cronin, a graduate student in Curriculum Studies, who has just returned from the Standing Rock camp and will also share her experience of being on the ground with the other water protectors. 

The teach-in will be followed by a march down to the Wabash River for a ceremonial offering, and then back to the NAECC for snacks. Come for all or part. Bring your lunch. This event is free and open to all.

12:00-1:30pm Teach-in w/ Dr. Dawn Marsh and Janelle Cornin
1:45-2:15pm    March to Wabash River for ceremonial offering
2:30-3:30pm    Snacks at the NAECC

Want to learn more before Tuesday? Here's a quick resource:

"THe Battle Over the Dakota Access Pipeline, Explained" http://www.vox.com/2016/9/9/12862958/dakota-access-pipeline-fight

data.name: Starry Night Music & Arts Festival 2016
data.description:
Starry Night is an annual street festival in downtown West Lafayette that draws thousands of people with its unique blend of excellent music, a variety of merchants, interactive creativity, and delicious food. The festival is designed to bring people together in community and seeks to expose the public to the neighborhood development work of Habitat for Humanity of Lafayette.

Starry Night is hosted by Campus House and Greyhouse Coffee and - thanks to our generous sponsors - is free! Come and be part of this amazing night!

Colony House (http://www.colonyhousemusic.com/)
Zach Vinson (http://www.zachvinson.com/)
Shiny Penny (http://www.shinypennyofficial.com/)
The Rocketboys (http://www.therocketboys.com/)
Grey Lamb (http://greylamb.bandcamp.com/)

#starrynightfestival

data.name: Greater Lafayette Startup Weekend 2016
data.description:
The hardest part of starting up is starting out. 

#GLSW2016 is focused on helping do-ers, dreamers, and trailblazers seize the opportunity to create new ventures right here on our home turf! Whether it’s an app or new piece of unique hardware, a new service or a new product, this is where you can take your idea from #imaginary to #innovationIRL! With the insight of experienced mentors throughout the weekend, participants will be coached through various aspects of startup formation, including customer validation, design, and business model development. On Sunday, teams present their startup and receive the feedback of judges based on the feasibility of their startup as a real business. The top teams will win prizes to help them take their idea to the next level.

Ready to get your startup started? Purchase your ticket at: bit.ly/GLStartupWeekend

Discount Codes
Students get 50% off with code "STUDENT"
MatchBOX Members get 50% off with code "MBX"
Foundry Clients get 50% with code "FOUNDRY"

Make sure you keep up with our Facebook, Twitter, and Blog!

data.name: TEDXPurdueU: Tear up the Box
data.description:
TEDxPurdueU, an independently organized TED (Technology, Entertainment, Design) event, uses storytelling to nurture a culture of innovation through sharing ideas developed by Purdue students, faculty, alumni, and community members with the global TED community. At TEDxPurdueU, several live speakers from diverse fields and schools of thought, such as history, science, education, the arts, engineering, business, and technology, will combine to spark deep discussion and interconnection among our community of lifelong learners.

With the introduction of an expanded, daylong format this season, attendees will receive even more engaging programming, exquisite conference gifts, and exclusive networking opportunities than ever before. In addition to their annual flagship conference, TEDxPurdueU hosts multiple activities year-round, fostering an environment for collaborative, interdisciplinary progress around the unique and thought-provoking stories in the Purdue and Greater Lafayette communities.

data.name: John Schnatter, founder and CEO of Papa John's Pizza
data.description:
John Schnatter, founder and CEO of Papa John's Pizza, will join President Mitch Daniels in an hour long discussion and audience Q&A.

FREE and Open to the Public

John Schnatter, founder and CEO of Papa John’s Pizza, will be featured in the Spring 2016 Presidential Lecture Series with Purdue President Mitch Daniels. The president will lead the hourlong discussion with Schnatter, which includes an audience question-and-answer session.

ABOUT JOHN SCHNATTER

John Schnatter profile photoSchnatter has strong ties to Indiana. He was born in Jeffersonville and earned a bachelor’s degree in business from Ball State University, delivering pizzas on campus while a student. After returning home to Jeffersonville in 1983, he started his own pizza company, knocking down a broom closet in his father’s tavern, installing an oven and delivering pizzas out of the back of the bar.

He believed by using fresh dough and quality ingredients, he could make the same great-tasting pizza that locally owned shops offered but didn’t deliver. Papa John’s is now the third-largest pizza chain in the world, with more than 4,700 restaurants in 50 states and 38 countries and territories, and a market capitalization of $2.2 billion.

Schnatter was inducted into the Louisville Achievement Business Hall of Fame in 2000 and the Junior Achievement U.S. Business Hall of Fame.

ABOUT THE PRESIDENTIAL LECTURE SERIES

The Presidential Lecture Series is a diverse series of lectures on policy, leadership, culture and society. The series will feature prominent experts and practitioners from various fields of interest for both the academics and the community at-large. Connected with each public presentation, speakers will be integrated into relevant curricular activities on the West Lafayette campus during their visits.

data.name: TEDxPurdueUSalon: What's the BIG Idea?

The event is FREE!

data.name: Epic Tech Talk
data.description:
UX Design When Lives are on the Line

Presenter: Janet Campbell

Long gone are the days when computer use was reserved for the experts. People young and old have been exposed to products that have gone through decades of user experience evolution, and they have come to expect a lot from the devices that they use on a day-to-day basis. As designers of these devices, it is no longer sufficient for today's CS graduates to just create functional, efficient, maintainable, and secure solutions -- our creations must be usable, engaging, and fun. But when it comes to software and devices that impact people's health, safety is of the utmost importance.

Epic is a healthcare software company that faces this design challenge every single day. Find out how you might incorporate user-centered design practices to make software that is not just safe, but also user-friendly. 

Food will be provided!
